meanings.definition: To give a favorable sign or indication
meanings.sent1: The bright rainbow auspicates good weather for our picnic.
meanings.sent2: The chirping of birds auspicates the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent3: The wagging tail of the dog auspicates a fun playtime ahead.
meanings.sent4: The blooming flowers auspicate a bountiful harvest in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The clear blue sky auspicates a peaceful day ahead.

meanings.definition: To initiate or inaugurate with ceremonies or formalities
meanings.sent1: The cutting of the ribbon auspicates the grand opening of the new store.
meanings.sent2: The lighting of the candles auspicates the beginning of the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The ringing of the bell auspicates the start of the school day.
meanings.sent4: The raising of the flag auspicates the official start of the event.
meanings.sent5: The clinking of glasses auspicates the toast to a new beginning.
